page.title: 13Local housing.
page.content: Housing development has taken place on the South side of Brampton. There are houses in the hamlets of Farlam and Milton and scattered farms and other dwellings. During the 19th century, detached, semi-detached and terraced houses were built of sand-stone, quarried in the Gelt Woods. The farm houses also date from this time and are of sand-stone. Tree road shows continuous housing development, with brick used in place of sandstone since the turn of the century. The houses and bugalows are typical of their own decades; substantially built pre-first world war houses, between-dwellings and more recent construction. Gelt Road and Capon Tree Road, though not yet completely in-filled show the same pattern. The western stretch of Capon Tree road has large, recent houses.
